alert.note: Alert for Barrow; Jackson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 2:57AM EST until January 11 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Middle Oconee River near Arcade affecting Jackson and Barrow Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Georgia... Middle Oconee River near Athens affecting Clarke and Oconee Counties. For the Middle Oconee River...including Auburn, Winder, Arcade, Athens...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Middle Oconee River near Arcade. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Minor flooding continues in the woodlands...fields and pasture upstream and downstream from the gage at Georgia Highway 82. A few dirt access roads and a residential yard just downstream will be flooded with up to two feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM EST Thursday the stage was 17.4 feet. The stage data on the AHPS is currently erroneous. The data on the USGS page is correct. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 AM EST Thursday was 17.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 6.5 feet early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.5 feet on 09/18/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued at 300 PM EST.early this morning at 400 AM EST.
